Española|Spanish]] [[Alvaro de Bazán class frigate|frigate]] ''[[Almirante Juan de Borbón (F102)|Almirante Juan de Borbon]]'' }} {{Infobox Ship Career |Hide header= |Ship country=United States |Ship 2002 |Ship acquired= |Ship commissioned=29 May 2004 |Ship decommissioned= |Ship in service= |Ship out of service= |Ship struck= |Ship reinstated= |Ship honors= |Ship fate= |Ship status={{Ship in active service}} |Ship notes= |Ship homeport=[[Naval Base San Diego]] |Ship motto=''Proud to Serve'' |Ship badge=[[File:USS Pinckney DDG-91 Crest.png|150px]] }} {{Infobox Ship Characteristics |Hide header= |Header caption= |Ship class=[[Arleigh Burke class destroyer]] |Ship displacement={{convert|9200|LT|abbr=on}} |Ship length={{convert|509|ft|6|in|abbr=on}} |Ship beam={{convert|66|ft|abbr=on}} |Ship draft={{convert|31|ft|abbr=on}} |Ship propulsion=4 × [[General Electric LM2500|General Electric LM2500-30]] [[gas turbine]]s, 2 shafts, {{convert|100000|shp|MW|abbr=on|lk=in}} |Ship speed=>{{convert|30|kn|abbr=on|lk=in}} |Ship range= |Ship complement=380 officers and enlisted |Ship sensors= |Ship EW= |Ship armament=1 x 32 cell, 1 x 64 cell Mk 41 [[vertical launch system]]s, 96 x [[RIM-66 Standard|RIM-66 SM-2]], [[BGM-109 Tomahawk]] or [[RUM-139 VL-Asroc]], missiles<br>1 x 5/62 in (127/62 mm), 2 x 25 mm, 4 x 12.7 mm guns<br>2 x Mk 46 triple torpedo tubes<br> 1 x 20mm [[Phalanx CIWS]] |Ship armor= |Ship aircraft=2 x [[SH-60 Sea Hawk]] helicopters |Ship aircraft facilities= |Ship notes= }} |} '''USS ''Pinckney'' (DDG-91)''' is an [[Arleigh Burke class destroyer|''Arleigh Burke''-class]] [[destroyer]] in the [[United States Navy]]. She is named for Cook First Class William Pinckney (1915–1975), who received the [[Navy Cross]] for his courageous rescue of a fellow crewmember on board [[USS Enterprise (CV-6)|''Enterprise'']] (CV-6) during the [[Battle of the Santa Cruz Islands|Battle of Santa Cruz]]. ''Pinckney'' was laid down on 16 July 2001 by [[Ingalls Shipbuilding]], at [[Pascagoula, Mississippi]]; [[Ship naming and launching|launched]] on 26 June 2002<!--; sponsored by Mrs. SPONSOR-->; and [[ship commissioning|commissioned]] on 29 May 2004 at [[Naval Construction Battalion Center Port Hueneme]]<!--, RANK CAPTAIN in command-->. As of 2010, ''Pinckney'' is commanded by Commander Matthew M. McGonigle, homeported at [[Naval Station San Diego|NS San Diego]], and assigned to Destroyer Squadron 23. ==Ship history== USS ''Pinckney'' made her maiden deployment September 2005. During this deployment, she made port visits to Guam, Singapore, Australia, Fiji and Hawaii. During this deployment, ''Pinckney'' became the first ever guided-missile destroyer to refuel and replenish the [[Mark V Special Operations Craft|Mark Five (MK V)]] high-performance combatant craft. She returned home after five months underway on 24 February 2006.<ref>[http://www.news.navy.mil/search/display.asp?story_id=22463 USS Pinckney Returns From Historic Deployment]. U.S. Navy</ref> On 16 February 2007, ''Pinckney'' was awarded the 2006 [[Battle E|Battle "E"]] award.<ref>[http://www.navy.mil/search/display.asp?story_id=27895 Surface Force Ships, Crews Earn Battle "E"]. U.S. Navy</ref> ''Pinckney'' departed San Diego on 2 April 2007 along with {{USS|Nimitz|CVN-68}} for a 6 month deployment. She returned home on 30 September 2007.<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.globalsecurity.org/military/library/news/2007/10/mil-071003-nns05.htm|title=Pinckney Returns Home|date=3 October 2007|accessdate=4 November 2008|publisher=US Navy}}</ref> ==References== {{reflist|1}} == External links == {{Commons category|USS Pinckney (DDG-91)}} *[http://www.pinckney.navy.mil/ USS ''Pinckney'' official website] *[http://www.navsource.org/archives/05/01091.htm navsource.org: USS ''Pinckney''] *[http://www.navysite.de/dd/ddg91.htm navysite.de: USS ''Pinckney''] {{Arleigh Burke class destroyer}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Pinckney (DDG-91)}} [[Category:Arleigh Burke-class destroyers]] [[Category:Active destroyers of the United States]] [[Category:Ships built in Mississippi]] [[Category:2002 ships]] [[Category:Carrier Strike Group Eleven]]
